subject: Politics
title: Oligarchy
description: A short lesson to help you apply Oligarchy.

hook.text: Russia has oligarchs. America has billionaire donors. When wealth controls government, democracy becomes a facade.

buildup.text: Oligarchy means rule by a small wealthy elite. It can exist inside formal democracies as well as dictatorships.

discovery.text: A Princeton study found US policy closely tracks the preferences of the wealthy, not the average citizen.

twist.text: Russian oligarchs were created by politics. American oligarchs buy politics. Different paths, similar outcomes.

climax.text: Populist movements arise when people feel oligarchs run the system. Trump and Sanders both channeled that anger.

punchline.text: Democracy and oligarchy can coexist. One is real; the other is a label.

quiz.question: What did a Princeton study find about US policy?
options: Policy closely tracks the preferences of the wealthy, not average citizens
All citizens have equal influence on policy outcomes
Poor citizens have more influence than wealthy ones
